message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CC

This paper introduces a new subclass of continuous-time recurrent neural networks and demonstrates their ability to approximate continuous mappings with a small number of computational units. This work is primarily focused on neural networks and their applications, which suggests that it is likely to be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the theoretical bounds on the neuronal states and varying time-constants, which could also place it under cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper's focus on approximation and modeling could also suggest categorization under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper's use of continuous-time models could also place it under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
